action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia marked as Closed
Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Rica Rosario Valencia

full_threads.body: @rica I have already done this one. Please add +45mins for me. Thanks!

Hi Heath
could the website be amended to include Brittany’s well made suggestion?

Kind regards,

Jeffrey Reinhardt

M +61 414 95 33 11 <tel:+61%20414%2095%2033%2011>

home@reinhardts.net <mailto:home@reinhardts.net>


> On 12 Jan 2021, at 9:05 am, Brittany Grimble <brittany@practiceedge.com.au <mailto:brittany@practiceedge.com.au>> wrote:
>
> ﻿
> Hi Guys,
>
> Hope you all had a great Christmas and a Happy New Year.
>
> I have been reviewing the user interactions with the website over the past 30 days since the amendments of the $250 deposit per product but we there haven't been any online sales in the past 30 days.
>
> As you are receiving organic clicks for brand and model specific keywords, they are landing directly on the product URL's (for example like below).
>
> Currently on the product pages users are presented with the $250 deposit required at checkout* without any further explanation of how the deposit works/what the next steps are in the purchase process.
>
> There is the specific mention of the 4 step process on the homepage, but not all users will see that as they are landing on the top-level brand category pages and individual product pages.
>
> <Screen Shot 2021-01-12 at 8.55.21 am.png>
>
>
> Is there a way that this clear explanation of the 4 step process could be carried across to the individual brand category pages and product pages - so that users understand the reference to the $250 deposit in the 4 step process?
>
> Thanks Brittany
>
> <Outlook-w4t14bu4.jpg>
>
> From: Heath Maguire - Wolf IQ <heath@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:heath@wolfiq.com.au>>
> Sent: Tuesday, 15 December 2020 12:04 PM
> To: Jeff & Lindsay Reinhardt <home@reinhardts.net <mailto:home@reinhardts.net>>
> Cc: Brittany Grimble <brittany@practiceedge.com.au <mailto:brittany@practiceedge.com.au>>; Steven Reinhardt <steven@reinhardts.net <mailto:steven@reinhardts.net>>
> Subject: Re: Individual Product Suggestions
>
> Hi Jeff,
>
> Sure, confirming we have made the below updates. We also included the $250 deposit info on the product page as well for consistency.
>
> Let me know if you would like any further changes?
>
> Thanks and speak soon,
> Heath Maguire
> CREATIVE DIRECTOR
>
> Phone: 1300 072 134 <tel:1300 072 134>
> Mobile: 0415 162 271 <tel:0415 162 271>
> Email: heath@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:heath@wolfiq.com.au>
>
> <https://wolfiq.com.au/>
>
>> On 1 Dec 2020, at 8:46 pm, home@reinhardts.net <mailto:home@reinhardts.net> wrote:
>>
>> Hi Heath
>> I think that Brittany’s point is well made.
>> Is this something you could attend to please?
>>
>>
>> From: Brittany Grimble <brittany@practiceedge.com.au <mailto:brittany@practiceedge.com.au>>
>> Sent: Thursday, 26 November 2020 4:27 PM
>> To: Jeff & Lindsay Reinhardt <home@reinhardts.net <mailto:home@reinhardts.net>>; Heath Maguire - Wolf IQ <heath@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:heath@wolfiq.com.au>>
>> Cc: Steven Reinhardt <steven@reinhardts.net <mailto:steven@reinhardts.net>>
>> Subject: Re: Individual Product Suggestions
>>
>> Hi All,
>>
>> I have had a look and just wondering if there is a way to present the purchase price for all products on the product category pages as $250 deposit: https://hearingyou.com.au/range/essential/ <https://hearingyou.com.au/range/essential/>
>>
>> Otherwise users are presented with all the products full price not just the mention of a $250 deposit.
>>
>> I am worried users will still be confused with the action they are required to take.
>> Since the changes nearly a month ago - have there been any online appointments booked or online hearing tests submitted?
>>
>> We can only see the booking page loads not the individual bookings and the outbound link clicks to the hearing test link.
>>
>> Thanks
>> Brittany
>>
>> <Outlook-jexmad5t.jpg>
>> From: Jeff & Lindsay Reinhardt <home@reinhardts.net <mailto:home@reinhardts.net>>
>> Sent: Thursday, 26 November 2020 3:52 PM
>> To: Heath Maguire - Wolf IQ <heath@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:heath@wolfiq.com.au>>
>> Cc: Steven Reinhardt <steven@reinhardts.net <mailto:steven@reinhardts.net>>; Brittany Grimble <brittany@practiceedge.com.au <mailto:brittany@practiceedge.com.au>>
>> Subject: Re: Individual Product Suggestions
>>
>> Hi Heath
>> This is much better.
>> Some fine tuning needed please
>> On step 2, in the “your order “ table, please align the $250 with the “Deposit payable now” sentence.
>> Then, could you show the dollar value of the “balance due at fitting $1234” (being the total cost less the deposit)
>> I would like this to appear as part of the sentence “Balance due” do that it is not confused with the deposit payable now.
>> Hope this makes sense, if not, please call me.
>> This could be one size larger than currently used
>>
>>
>> Kind regards,
>>
>> Jeffrey Reinhardt
>>
>> M +61 414 95 33 11 <tel:+61%20414%2095%2033%2011>
>>
>>
>> home@reinhardts.net <mailto:home@reinhardts.net>
>>
>>
>>

>>>
>>> ﻿Hi Steven,
>>>
>>> Just confirming we have made the below updates. Please test it and let me know your thoughts.
>>>
>>> Regarding the ‘Hearing Loss FAQ’s’ changing to FAQ… We can make that change, but this reduces the SEO potency of that page. Let me know?
>>>
>>> Thanks,
>>> Heath Maguire
>>> CREATIVE DIRECTOR
>>>
>>> Phone: 1300 072 134 <tel:1300%20072%20134>
>>> Mobile: 0415 162 271 <tel:0415%20162%20271>
>>> Email: heath@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:heath@wolfiq.com.au>
>>> <https://wolfiq.com.au/>
>>>
>>>
>>>> On 25 Nov 2020, at 8:04 pm, Steven Reinhardt <steven@reinhardts.net <mailto:steven@reinhardts.net>> wrote:
>>>>
>>>> Hi Heath,
>>>> Thank you for amending this change, however its still not clear to the end user that all is needed is a $250 refundable deposit to proceed, and remainder to be paid at fitting. Can we please make this clearer and more prominent perhaps on the home page in the 4 step process (under fit and pay).
>>>> After your payment of a $250 refundable deposit, we invite you to one of the many Northside Audiology clinics for your fitting. An Audiologist will fit and tune your device(s). The balance of the payment is made at the completion of the appointment, all major credit cards accepted. We provide a 60 day trial period, and all manufacturer warranties apply.
>>>>
>>>> Under the Hearing loss FAQ's please rename this to FAQ.
>>>>
>>>> In the cart section can we do the following?
>>>> Instead of subtotal put total cost. instead of total put deposit payable now and add another row saying balance due at fitting
>>>>
>>>>
>>>> Thanks
>>>>
>>>> Steve
>>>>
>>>>

>>>>>>>> On 24 Nov 2020, at 4:27 pm, <home@reinhardts.net <mailto:home@reinhardts.net>> <home@reinhardts.net <mailto:home@reinhardts.net>> wrote:
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> Hello Heath
>>>>>>>> I think the website is vastly improved, but there is a huge flaw in the process once you add an aid to the cart.
>>>>>>>> When you add to the cart, it does not show the price, nor a sub total.
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> If you scroll down, it asks for a $250 deposit but there is no explanation of how and when the balance is due.
>>>>>>>> I believe that anyone getting this far would leave the site at this point as it so poorly explained.
>>>>>>> *Please provide the explanation and we will happily add it to the cart page.
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> Also, at the foot of the payment page the banner “Find your perfect hearing aid “ appears, with the three options, “Know what you need? ”Not sure what you need?” “Take an on line hearing test” I think this banner should not appear on the payment page, it would only make sense to have a “contact us “button at this point.
>>>>>>> *Removed.
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> On the payment page we need to show clearly that the deposit is $250 per aid, what the balance owing is and advise customers that the final payment will be requested at the fitting appointment( I am assuming the deposit is $250 per aid, Steven, is this correct?)
>>>>>>> *Steven please confirm and we will updated accordingly.
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> It would be good to remind them on the payment page that they do get a 60 day trial period with a full refund if they are not satisfied.
>>>>>>> *This is already there.
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> Kind regards,
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> Jeffrey Reinhardt
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> home@reinhardts.net <mailto:home@reinhardts.net>
>>>>>>>> M +61 0414 953 311
